body_html:
(Overall the most user-friendly approach might be to mount the local filesystem in the container, something like:

git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
cd tensorflow/tensorflow/examples/udacity
docker run -v $PWD:/notebooks -p 8888:8888 -it b.gcr.io/tensorflow-udacity/assignments:0.5.0

Then people who don't know Docker would be able to see the files in their normal filesystem, could simply run the docker run command again whenever they want, edit files locally, et cetera…

But anyway these are just some rambling thoughts! 🙉 It's a great course so far, thanks. I'm sure everyone figures out the nuances of Docker one way or another.)

```
git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
cd tensorflow/tensorflow/examples/udacity
docker run -v $PWD:/notebooks -p 8888:8888 -it b.gcr.io/tensorflow-udacity/assignments:0.5.0
```

Then people who don't know Docker would be able to see the files in their normal filesystem, could simply run the `docker run` command again whenever they want, edit files locally, et cetera…

But anyway these are just some rambling thoughts! 🙉 It's a great course so far, thanks. I'm sure everyone figures out the nuances of Docker one way or another.)
